title: Freelance Rate Calculator
description: Determine your minimum freelance hourly rate based on target salary and actual billable hours.
methodSummary: Freelance hourly rate = target annual income / (billable hours per week Ã— weeks worked per year)
assumptions: Assumes business expenses and extra taxes are either part of target income or calculated separately.
Billable hours are often only 50-60% of total working hours.
insights: A common mistake freelancers make is assuming 40 billable hours per week; administration and sales drastically reduce this.
If leaving employment, add at least 30% to your target salary to cover benefits, self-employment taxes, and equipment risk.

faqs.q: Why shouldn't I just take my old hourly salary wage and charge that?
faqs.a: Because your employer covers non-billable time, taxes, software, healthcare, and assumes the financial risk of no-work periods. You must charge a premium to absorb these costs.
